contentrichtext.text: {{ref improve|date=February 2013}} {{Infobox scientist | name = Fritz Albert Lipmann | image = Portrait of Fritz Albert Lipmann (1899-1986), Biochemist (2551001689).jpg | image_size = 180px | birth_date = {{birth date|1899|6|12|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Königsberg]], [[Germany]] | nationality = German-American | death_date = {{death date and age|1986|7|24|1899|6|12|mf=y}} | death_place = [[Poughkeepsie, New York]], U.S. | field = [[Biochemistry]] | workplaces = [[Max Planck Institute for Medical Research|Kaiser Wilhelm Institute for Medical Research]] | alma_mater = [[University of Königsberg]]<br>[[University of Berlin]]<br>[[University of Munich]]<br>[[Kaiser Wilhelm Institute]] | known_for = Co-discoverer in 1945 of [[coenzyme A]] | prizes = [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine]] (1953) | spouse =Elfreda M. Hall Lipmann (m. 1931; 1 child) }} '''Fritz Albert Lipmann''', [[ForMemRS]]<ref name="frs">{{cite doi|10.1098/rsbm.1999.0088}}</ref> (June 12, 1899 – July 24, 1986) was a German-American [[biochemist]] and a co-discoverer in 1945 of [[coenzyme A]]. For this, together with other research on coenzyme A, he was awarded half the [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine]] in 1953 (shared with [[Hans Adolf Krebs]]). ==Life and career== Lipmann was born in [[Königsberg]], [[Germany]], to a [[Jewish]] family. His parents were Gertrud (Lachmanski) and Leopold Lipmann, an attorney.<ref>http://www.nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/1953/lipmann-bio.html</ref> Lipmann studied medicine at the [[University of Königsberg]], [[University of Berlin|Berlin]], and [[University of Munich|Munich]], graduating in Berlin in 1924. He returned to Königsberg to study chemistry under Professor [[Hans Meerwein]]. In 1926 he joined [[Otto Meyerhof]] at the [[Kaiser Wilhelm Institute]], Berlin, for his Ph.D. thesis. After that he followed Meyerhof to [[Heidelberg]] to the [[Max Planck Institute for Medical Research|Kaiser Wilhelm Institute for Medical Research]]. From 1939 on, he lived and worked in the [[USA]]. From 1949 to 1957 he was professor of [[biochemistry|biological chemistry]] at [[Harvard Medical School]]. From 1957 onwards, he taught and conducted research at [[Rockefeller University]], [[New York, New York|New York City]]. He was awarded the [[National Medal of Science]] in 1966. He died in New York in 1986.<ref>[http://www.nytimes.com/1986/07/25/obituaries/fritz-a-lipman-biochemist-dies.html]</ref> ==See also== *[[List of Jewish Nobel laureates]] *[[Hans Adolf Krebs]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://nobelprize.org/nobel_prizes/medicine/laureates/1953/lipmann-bio.html Nobel Prize biography] *[https://www.jewishvirtuallibrary.org/jsource/biography/lipmann.html jewish virtual library biography] *[http://www.fli-leibniz.de/index_en.php Leibniz Institute for Age Research - Fritz Lipmann Institute (FLI)] *[http://www.nasonline.org/publications/biographical-memoirs/memoir-pdfs/lipmann-fritz-a.pdf National Academy of Sciences Biographical Memoir] {{Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine Laureates 1951-1975}} {{Winners of the National Medal of Science|biological}} {{Authority control|VIAF=74648188|GND=118728512}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Lipmann, Fritz Albert | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =American biochemist | DATE OF BIRTH = June 12, 1899 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Königsberg]], [[Germany]] | DATE OF DEATH = July 24, 1986 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Poughkeepsie, New York]], U.S. }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Lipmann, Fritz Albert}} [[Category:1899 births]] [[Category:1986 deaths]] [[Category:People from Kaliningrad]] [[Category:American biochemists]] [[Category:American Nobel laureates]] [[Category:German emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:American people of German-Jewish descent]] [[Category:German Nobel laureates]] [[Category:Jewish American scientists]] [[Category:Nobel laureates in Physiology or Medicine]] [[Category:People from East Prussia]] [[Category:People from Königsberg]] [[Category:University of Königsberg alumni]] [[Category:Humboldt University of Berlin alumni]] [[Category:Ludwig Maximilian University of Munich alumni]] [[Category:University of Heidelberg alumni]] [[Category:Harvard Medical School faculty]] [[Category:National Medal of Science laureates]] [[Category:Foreign Members of the Royal Society]] [[Category:Rockefeller University people]] [[Category:Alexander von Humboldt Fellows]] {{US-biochemist-stub}}
